fpmExplorer:Page.title: Form Extensions
fpmExplorer:Page.introduction: Form extensions enable you to define custom inline fields and extend your forms.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Add Further Properties
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: You can add further properties to your form by using the FormElement macro. The placement and anchor attributes define where the new element will be added.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Add Custom Form Elements
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: You can also add custom form elements to your form. In this example, a slider is added as a custom field.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Add Elements through Manifest
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: If you want to add elements to your object page form rendered through UI.Facet annotations, you can use the 'fields' property in the controlConfiguration section of the respective UI.FieldGroup.
